intro: Brownleea flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered brownleea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. Its leaves are simple and opposite, with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Brownleea flavescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
